Name: Statue of In-heret-shu as a Mummy
Description: The statue is one of several gilded wooden statues of deities found in the tomb of Tutankhamun. It depicts the god In-heret-shu standing on a rectangular base. He is portrayed in the form of a mummy and his body is completely enveloped in a cloak. He wears a three-part wig on his head topped by four high feathers. His arms are crossed on his chest, which is adorned by a large pectoral. His body is entirely gilded, except for his eyes, eyebrows, and false beard.
